sentence: Stepan Company ( SCL ) will begin trading ex-dividend on May 26, 2017.
A cash dividend payment of $0.205 per share is scheduled to be paid on June 15, 2017.
Shareholders who purchased SCL prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment.
This marks the 4th quarter that SCL has paid the same dividend.
The previous trading day's last sale of SCL was $85.08, representing a -5.36% decrease from the 52 week high of $89.90 and a 51.79% increase over the 52 week low of $56.05.
SCL is a part of the Basic Industries sector, which includes companies such as Procter & Gamble Company ( PG ) and Unilever NV ( UN ).
SCL's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $3.83.
Zacks Investment Research reports SCL's forecasted earnings growth in 2017 as 8.24%, compared to an industry average of 7.6%.
For more information on the declaration, record and payment dates, visit the SCL Dividend History page.
Our Dividend Calendar has the full list of stocks that have an ex-dividend today.
